title: HHS Kennedy Appoints New Interagency Autism Coordinating Committee
source: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
summary: Secretary Kennedy announces new appointments to the Interagency Autism Coordinating Committee (IACC), signaling potential shifts in federal autism policy and research priorities.

title: CDC Reports Autism Prevalence Now 1 in 36 Children
source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
summary: Latest CDC surveillance data shows continued increase in autism prevalence, with rates varying significantly by state and demographic factors.

title: NIH Awards $100M for Autism Biomarker Research
summary: New funding initiative aims to identify early biological markers for autism to enable earlier diagnosis and intervention.

title: Maryland Expands Autism Waiver Services
summary: New state funding increases access to home and community-based services for Maryland families with autistic children.

title: Study Finds Early Intervention Before Age 2 Most Effective
summary: Meta-analysis of 50+ studies confirms that behavioral interventions started before age 2 show significantly better outcomes than later intervention.

title: New Autism Speaks Resource Guide for Newly Diagnosed Families
summary: Updated 100 Day Kit provides roadmap for families in the critical first 100 days after an autism diagnosis.

title: Insurance Coverage for ABA Therapy Now Mandated in All 50 States
summary: Final state passes autism insurance reform, making ABA therapy coverage a requirement nationwide.

title: Gut Microbiome Study Reveals New Autism Subtypes
summary: Large-scale microbiome analysis identifies distinct gut bacteria profiles that may explain symptom variation in autism.
